intro: Geonoma multiflora var. discolor, commonly known as the variegated geonoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage that features a mix of green, white, and pink hues. Its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of red and orange, adding visual interest to the plant. Geonoma multiflora var. discolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to indoor conditions.
